docs.snippet: LONDON, Sept. 17 -- With increased prospects of a Government budget in the coming fall, the stock markets here today started the new account on a cautious note.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Sept. 17 -- With increased prospects of a Government budget in the coming fall, the stock markets here today started the new account on a cautious note.

headline.main: BONDS AND SHARES ON LONDON MARKET; Gains Recorded in Various Groups on Light Trading After Cautious Start

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: YESTERDAY'S EVENTS General Assembly Met at 11:23 A.M. and received Secretary General's report on matters before Security Council and its decision to refer Greek question to Assembly for recommendations.

docs.snippet: LONDON, Sept. 18 -- Although business was not very large a more cheerful tone marked the trading in stock markets here today. Persistent inquiries from the Provinces caused dealers to mark up industrial share prices sharply as they were caught short...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Sept. 18 -- Although business was not very large a more cheerful tone marked the trading in stock markets here today. Persistent inquiries from the Provinces caused dealers to mark up industrial share prices sharply as they were caught short of stock.

headline.main: BONDS AND SHARES ON LONDON MARKET; More Cheerful Tone Marks Trading, With Industrial Shares Rising Sharply

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON, Sept. 19 -- Fears were expressed before the opening of the stock markets here today that the outburst of Andrei Y. Vishinsky, Deputy Foreign Minister of the Soviet Union, against Great Britain and the United States last night before the...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Sept. 19 -- Fears were expressed before the opening of the stock markets here today that the outburst of Andrei Y. Vishinsky, Deputy Foreign Minister of the Soviet Union, against Great Britain and the United States last night before the United Nations General Assembly in New York would affect sentiment in the markets here.

headline.main: BONDS AND SHARES ON LONDON MARKET; General Advance of Prices Laid to Light Offerings and Steady Buying

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: To the editor of THE NEW YORK TIMES: Mr. Bevin has indicated that America has not done, enough for Britain; it 'should do much more because of the dollar crisis. The facts clearly show that Britain is suffering from, a pound sterling crisis.
docs.lead_paragraph: To the editor of THE NEW YORK TIMES: Mr. Bevin has indicated that America has not done, enough for Britain; it 'should do much more because of the dollar crisis. The facts clearly show that Britain is suffering from, a pound sterling crisis.

headline.main: The British Crisis I; It Is Considered Primarily to Be a Pound Sterling Crisis

docs.snippet: THE first sounds of celebration on the occasion of the League of Composers' twenty-fifth anniversary have already been heard. Eighteen of America's most prominent orchestras, including the New York Philharmonic-Symphony the New York City Symphony and...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE first sounds of celebration on the occasion of the League of Composers' twenty-fifth anniversary have already been heard. Eighteen of America's most prominent orchestras, including the New York Philharmonic-Symphony the New York City Symphony and the CBS Symphony, intend to schedule one of the eighty-six works commissioned by the league to date.

headline.main: THE WORLD OF MUSIC: 25 YEARS FOR LEAGUE; Orchestras Throughout Country Observe Anniversary of Composers' Group

docs.snippet: CRISTOBAL, Canal Zone -- A travel bargain -- a trip around South America for a fare of $645 -- is offered here by the Royal Netherlands Steamship Line. The voyage takes about four months with stops in many ports, including three weeks in Buenos...
docs.lead_paragraph: CRISTOBAL, Canal Zone -- A travel bargain -- a trip around South America for a fare of $645 -- is offered here by the Royal Netherlands Steamship Line. The voyage takes about four months with stops in many ports, including three weeks in Buenos Aires.

headline.main: Limited Number of Passengers Taken Around South America for $645

docs.snippet: Week Ended Sept. 19, 1947 Pound sterling for spot and future delivery showed a firm undertone on a good turnover last week, an indication that there has been a lifting of the pressure which recently had effected irregularity in those documents....
docs.lead_paragraph: Week Ended Sept. 19, 1947 Pound sterling for spot and future delivery showed a firm undertone on a good turnover last week, an indication that there has been a lifting of the pressure which recently had effected irregularity in those documents. Balancing of demand for spot by commercials, contrasted with activity in futures representing hedges against commitments left the values of each moderately above those of the preceding week.
